abstract: Elite marathon runner Buzunesh Deba, who is a contender to win the New York City Marathon, chooses to train in New York City, sharing sidewalks with the amateurs who make up most of the city's jogging population; if Deba were to win the marathon, she would be the first New Yorker to do so since its expansion in 1976.
snippet: When the elite runner Buzunesh Deba trains, she shares sidewalks and park paths with the amateurs who make up most of the city’s jogging population.
lead_paragraph: When the elite runner Buzunesh Deba trains, she shares sidewalks and park paths with the amateurs who make up most of the city’s jogging population.

headline.main: Elite Marathoner Is Right at Home on the Streets of New York
headline.print_headline: Elite Marathoner Is Right at Home on the Streets of New York
headline.seo: Deba Could Be the First New Yorker to Win the City’s Marathon
